thread.title: Dimdex 2016: US exporters grow share of MENA maritime market
thread.title_full: Dimdex 2016: US exporters grow share of MENA maritime market

author: eTN Global Editor
title: Dimdex 2016: US exporters grow share of MENA maritime market
text:
Dimdex 2016: US exporters grow share of MENA maritime market Adv: 
Aug 05, 2015 Adv: 
DOHA, Qatar and WALDWICK, NJ - More US maritime equipment and services companies competing for business in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region are turning their sights toward Doha, Qatar and Dimdex 2016 to get closer to decision-makers and purchasing influencers directly affiliated with the area's maritime defense and security operators and their global partners. 
To accommodate this growing demand, show organizers have contracted Kallman Worldwide to market Dimdex 2016 in the United States, and to organize its flagship U.S. International Pavilion at next year's event. Kallman currently represents three of the world's most influential maritime, defense and security industry trade shows, including PACIFIC 2015. 
Dimdex 2016 will be held March 29 through 31, 2016 at the Qatar National Convention Center in Doha. The U.S. International Pavilion will encompass 1,230 sqm of space in Hall 6, a prime location for visitor traffic and attention. 
"Now in its fifth edition, Dimdex has grown to become one of most important events in the maritime industry because of its proven ability to draw hands-on buyers with budget and decision-making authority from the MENA region and around the world," said Kallman Worldwide President and CEO, Tom Kallman. "We are proud to have been asked to represent this business opportunity to our nation's maritime equipment, product and service providers, and look forward to helping them grow their share of the regional and global marketplace at Dimdex 2016." 
In 2014, more than 13,000 trade visitors, including 82 delegations from 58 countries, attended Dimdex. More than 190 exhibitors from 30 countries announced some $23 billion in deals. As the region establishes itself as a global cargo hub, show organizers are anticipating more visitors and exhibitors to compete for corresponding defense and security infrastructure and equipment contracts. 
"Over the past 10 years, Dimdex has established itself as one of the world's major meeting places for maritime, defense and security leaders," said Kallman. "We are confident that the addition of the U.S. International Pavilion organized by Kallman Worldwide will ensure increased U.S. participation at Dimdex 2016, and heightened interest in U.S. exhibitors among show attendees."
